page.title: 12SALMON FISHING :BERE FERRERS
page.content: Salmon Fishing is very strictly controlled. There was one licence for Bere Ferrers in the area upstream. It was fished with a specified net from a rowing boat. "Mr Percy Eliot was fishing when we walked along a wooded, riverside footpath opposite Bere Ferrers. He was holding one end of a non-treated net, the other end being hooked to a boat which was out on the river. They were going against the tide. Then Mr Eliot shouted "stop." So the man in the boat rowed in, took the net from the boat and started pulling it in. We were all watching in silence while they pulled and pulled the sixty feet of net. Then they had to position the bunt (centre float) so they pulled on one side until it was in the middle. There was a splashing and they pulled in a sea trout (peel).That made six.
